alert.note: Alert for Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 10:41AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Pike County through 1130 AM CDT... At 1041 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Petrey, or 9 miles north of Luverne, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Troy, Brundidge, Goshen, Banks, Kent, Antioch, Linwood, Ansley, Troy Municipal Airport, Troy University, Monticello, Orion, Josie, Sandfield, Brundidge Municipal Airport and Mossy Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
